revised_title: Preliminary Observations of the Magellanic Clouds with the Ultraviolet Sky Survey Telescope
tldr: The authors conducted preliminary observations of the Magellanic Clouds using the ultraviolet sky survey telescope on the E.S.R.O. satellite TD-1A. They derived the ultraviolet surface brightness for four wavelength bands and compared the flux distributions in each cloud with a galactic luminosity function. The results showed that the Small Magellanic Cloud had a lower ultraviolet surface brightness than the Large Magellanic Cloud, likely due to a smaller space density of early-type stars.
